main event: On 19 January 1956, a large domed object, the size of a bushel basket held at arm's length, was observed hovering with three smaller objects circling it for 1 minute 15 seconds.
interesting points: The large object was a brilliant green color with a lighter shade of green underneath., The entire observation lasted for 1 hour and 5 seconds., The sighting occurred during daylight., Initial conclusions suggested the sighting was probably a balloon or an astronomical event., The reporting officer noted that typical meteor sightings do not occur in daylight.
sighted object: one large domed object and three smaller objects
witness description: The observer was a pilot with extensive flying experience, having over 2300 hours of fighter time.
